answerText: zeta potential [prompt on "potential"][10] Zeta potentials are a measure of the stability of these substances, which consist of an insoluble phase suspended in a dispersion medium. Foams and emulsions are examples.
heading: PADAWAN |2014 | 7 | 6 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  The Smoluchowski equation can be used to calculate this quantity only when the Debye length is much smaller than the particle radius. [10] Name this quantity that, if greater than around 30 millivolts or so, indicates that a system near a double layer is more or less stable.
